definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
Old Towpath along the Grand Canal in Zhejiang Province

sentences.english: A path along a canal or river used by animals towing boats.
sentences.chinese: 一条沿着运河或河流的，由动物来拖船拉纤的纤道。

sentences.english: " shouted Robert, laughing and running out onto the towpath, zipping his shorts as he went.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特大喊，笑着朝纤道跑去，一边跑一边拉上短裤。

definition: Old Towpath along the Grand Canal in Zhejiang Province
Xiao Qiao, one of the Two Qiaos, according to Romance of the Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], the two great beauties of ancient China
plank walkway constructed on the face of a cliff/(archaic) elevated passageway connecting the upper levels of adjacent towers
road or pavement laid with flagstones
person who lives and makes a living on a boat/boatman/boat dweller
